page.title: 06Little House Farm
page.content: Little House farm is owned by Mr & Mrs Miller. There are twenty five acres in Ditchingham and another eleven in Thwaite for hay. On the farm they have hereford beef cattle because the field floods and the soil is poor. We also saw twenty Kerry hill sheep and Meg the sheep dog who tried unsuccessfully to round them up.Herefords are red with white faces.Every cow has a calf once a year and the bull calves are sold. Electric Lady came over from Canada by plane and is the mother of a baby bull.There are six bull calves, there are three young bulls, three heifer calves, and eighteen breeding cows. This is roughly one animal to one acres. The food is stored in a dutch barn. They eat grass and concentrate. The creep feeder containing concentrates can be adjusted so that only the lambs go in.
